p: Since the beginning of the new decade of the 21st centuryâ€”2020, humanity has been burdened by the emergence of a novel coronavirus known as SARS-CoV-2 (severe acute respiratory syndrome coronavirus 2), which caused a deadly outbreak of coronavirus disease (COVID-19) [ 1]. The first mention of this novel virus dates from the end of December 2019, and it is linked to a cluster of atypical pneumonia cases (27 cases) recorded in Wuhan, Hubei province, China [ 2, 3]. The infection was declared a pandemic on 11 March 2020 by the World Health Organization (WHO) [ 4] and became an imperious public health concern.
